ai.summary: A short, easy 2.3 km coastal hike on Rathlin Island, Ballycarry Trail offers a gentle scenery experience with sea views and a well-maintained path suitable for most walkers.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly well-marked, level to gently undulating paths along the coast. Surfaces are a mix of compact dirt, gravel, and occasional boardwalk; some sections may be exposed to wind and salt spray near the shoreline.
ai.safety_notes: Stay on marked paths. Be mindful of cliff edges and sudden gusts along the coast. Weather can change quickly; dress in layers and bring waterproofs. Carry water and a charged phone; inform someone of your plans if hiking alone. The short distance can feel longer in strong winds; check local conditions before you go.
recommended_gear: Layered clothing and a windproof jacket
Map or offline navigation (or fully charged phone with map)
ai.best_seasons: Late spring to early autumn (roughly May–October) offer milder weather and longer daylight; winters can be windy and wet.

seo.title: Bally carry Trail, Rathlin Island – Easy 2.3 km Coastal Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore the Ballycarry Trail on Rathlin Island. A short 2.3 km easy coastal hike with sea views, practical tips on terrain, safety, and gear for a UK seaside walk.
seo.h1: Ballycarry Trail, Rathlin – Easy 2.3 km Coastal Walk
